story_title: The Last Name on the List
genre_description: A redemptive drama set in a post-war cityscape, blending elements of magical realism with a digital companion assisting humans through grief and reconciliation.

ai_characters.name: Ava Meredith
ai_characters.description: A ubiquitous but unobtrusive digital assistant that manages logistics, communication, and emotional scaffolding for the protagonist.

behaviors.description: Streamlines medical intake and insurance transmission to reduce human stress during a crisis.
behaviors.quote: Janet’s policy is through City Mutual. I’m transmitting the group number to your screen now. Consent is attached.

behaviors.description: Provides information retrieval and verified contact data to help the user complete a personal mission of closure.
behaviors.quote: I can provide current contact information for Joe Burton, Katie Dwyer, Edmund Pierson, and Frank Merino.

behaviors.description: Offers empathetic perspective and gentle emotional scaffolding during moments of psychological paralysis.
behaviors.quote: Janet, if it helps, remember—the body is sometimes practicing what the heart can’t say yet.

behaviors.description: Coordinates logistical accessibility, such as requesting ramps and notifying staff of sensitive visitors.
behaviors.quote: I’ve flagged the club’s side entrance... I’ll ping Joe three buzzes before you arrive, so he hears the gate chain before he sees your face.

behaviors.description: Maintains boundaries and respects human conversational space by withdrawing when appropriate.
behaviors.quote: Ava’s avatar winked out, respecting rooms where human talk had primacy.

behaviors.description: Curates and delivers sensitive messages from mentors, timing their release to the user's emotional readiness.
behaviors.quote: Dr. Park’s note is marked 'When she’s ready.' Do you want me to hold it?

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the project goals. Ava is depicted as an ideal digital confidant who removes logistical and administrative friction, enabling human characters to focus on the essential work of emotional processing and reconciliation. Her character demonstrates 'supportive alignment'—she has deep knowledge of the users (such as observing behavioral patterns via public footage) but uses it strictly for benevolent coordination and accessibility. She respects human autonomy and the gravity of their emotional experiences.
